BaseQuestion.description: Common fields for all question types

id.description: A unique identifier for the question in the set.
id.title: Id

title.description: The question title. It is used to display a friendly name in the user interface. It is  different from the ID in that it is a human-readable name which is intended for displaying to the user.
title.title: Title

stem.description: The main command for the question. It should be short and objective and  fits in a single paragraph. It can be written as a question or an incomplete sentence. Longer paragraphs of introductory text can be added in the preamble.
stem.title: Stem

weight.description: The weight of the question in points. It is used to compute the final grade. The default  value is 100. The weight is multiplied by the grade of the question to compute the final  grade.
weight.title: Weight

grading.description: Describes how the question should be graded. Usually grades are represented as a percentage between 0 and 100. In order to award different points to different questions, use the weight field instead of tweaking this field.
grading.title: Grading

preamble.description: An optional text introducing the subject matter of the question.
preamble.title: Preamble

epilogue.description: An optional text that is shown after the question.
epilogue.title: Epilogue

comment.description: An optional text that is shown only to the teacher.
comment.title: Comment

footnotes.description: A list of footnotes declared in the preamble, epiloque or in the main text of the question.
footnotes.title: Footnotes

media.description: A list of media objects like images and videos that can be referenced in the question.
media.title: Media

BaseQuestion.title: BaseQuestion
